sentences: She kept the tiny, beautiful seashell as a sweet, happy keepsake.
His grandmother gave him a truly ancient, valuable gold watch as a family keepsake.
The small, clear photograph serves as a deeply wonderful keepsake of their trip.
The hard-working farmer wiped his sweaty brow with a red kerchief.
She tied a brightly colored, silk kerchief gently around her messy hair.
He bravely offered a clean, white kerchief to the totally sad, loudly crying woman.
Like many stereotypes … this one too contains some kernels of truth.
a kernel of corn
… as brown in hue as hazelnuts, and sweeter than the kernels.
The incredibly hot, deep brick kiln perfectly baked the heavy clay pottery.
The totally skilled artist carefully placed the delicate vase into the hot kiln.
They totally built a massive, outdoor kiln to safely fire the huge statues.
The beautiful Japanese woman wore a highly elegant, floral silk kimono.
She carefully tied the wide, heavy sash around her brand new kimono.
He proudly bought a highly traditional, entirely authentic kimono in Tokyo.
The truly kind-hearted stranger happily helped the old lady easily cross the street.
A completely kind-hearted neighbor volunteered to softly watch their new puppy.
The deeply kind-hearted nurse softly comforted the highly scared, sick child.
The young, entirely scared prince feared the heavy, massive burden of kingship.
The wise, old ruler truly understood the deep duties of kingship.
His highly brief, terrible kingship ended in a massive, totally sudden rebellion.
The massive, highly loud wedding reunited all his distant kinsfolk.
She happily invited all her close kinsfolk to the giant holiday dinner.
The totally brave, loyal chief completely fought to safely protect his kinsfolk.
The greedy, sly merchant was well known for his blatant knavery.
His cruel knavery completely ruined the poor, trusting family.
The clever detective easily saw right through the criminal's obvious knavery.
kneaded sore neck muscles
kneading dough
a collection of colorful knickknacks

Known in the computer industry as tchotchkes, which is Yiddish for cheap trinkets, the knickknacks distributed in the past year have included Love Me Tender toilet-roll dispensers, wax eyeballs, chocolate computers and Nerf-ball launchers.

Melissa Etheridge's spacious two-story home outside Los Angeles is filled with knickknacks from her life: Aside from awards and photos, there is a small collection of vintage neon clocks … and a Thelma & Louise poster signed by the cast (including a then-unknown Brad Pitt).
The brave warrior was finally granted a royal knighthood.
He received his official knighthood from the queen herself.
The ancient stories told of a time when knighthood meant ultimate honor.
The municipal water reservoir lost an entire kiloliter of drinking water due to a sudden rupture in the primary transport pipe.
Our massive brewing vat holds precisely one kiloliter of fermented barley mixture at maximum capacity.
A commercial swimming pool requires several kiloliters of treated water to maintain a safe depth for competitive diving.
The exhausted marathon runner realized she still had one grueling kilometer left before reaching the finish line.
From the observation deck, you can see for a full kilometer across the dense, fog-covered valley.
The damaged spacecraft drifted a kilometer away from the orbital station before the rescue tether engaged.
The sprawling solar array generated an extra kilowatt of clean energy during the unusually bright afternoon.
Upgrading the antiquated factory equipment saved the company thousands of dollars per kilowatt in electricity costs.
A standard space heater running at maximum output will consume roughly one kilowatt of power every hour.
The arrogant kingling ruled his tiny, impoverished province with the pompous delusion of a mighty emperor.
Rival factions easily overthrew the weak kingling, annexing his insignificant territory into the expanding empire.
Historians barely mention the forgotten kingling who briefly claimed the throne of the fractured border kingdom.
The romanticized knight errant roamed the perilous countryside, seeking formidable dragons to slay and innocent villagers to rescue.
Clad in battered steel armor, the solitary knight errant offered his formidable sword to any noble cause he encountered.
Medieval literature often depicts the knight errant as a chivalrous wanderer bound by a strict code of personal honor.
